change.item: Batch update to change subject links.

did.unittitle: Pound mss. IV
did.abstract: The Pound mss. IV consist of articles, poems, plays, and other writings by various authors that were sent to Ezra or Dorothy Pound by those authors.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Ezra Pound was an expatriate American poet and critic and one of the leaders of the early modernist movement. Born in Idaho, he attended the University of Pennsylvania and went on to teach briefly at Wabash College in Crawfordsville, Indiana before traveling overseas and living in London, Paris, and Italy, then returning to the States in 1945. Pound went back to Italy in 1958 and died in Venice in 1972.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged alphabetically by author.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Included is a carbon typescript of Noel Stock's The Life of Ezra Pound ( London: Routledge & Kegan Paul, 1970) with annotations and corrections by Dorothy Pound. Other authors represented include Louis Dudek, Robert Duncan, Achilles Fang, Giovanni Giovannini, Raymond Hughes, Hugh Kenner, D.D. Paige, Desmond Stewart, Henry Swabey, Peter Whigham, Robert McNair Wilson, and Stanislaus Yankowski.
Note on Indexing Term - "Literature--translating": Includes translations of works in various languages.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: See Pound mss. I, Pound mss. II, Pound mss. III, Pound mss. V, Pound mss. VI, Pound mss. VII,, also located at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift. Omar S. Pound, Princeton, New Jersey. 1986

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Pound mss. IV, Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

controlaccess.subject: Literature--translating
controlaccess.persname: Stock, Noel. Life of Ezra Pound.

did.unittitle: Bunting, Basil. Poem: "The Spoils." T.(carbon)D.S. 10p. Moderate corrections in ink by author. 1951. Published in Poetry in 1951 and later published separately ().
Chang, Carsun. "Chu Chih-Yu, the 17th-Century Chinese Refugee philosopher in Japan and his Japanese disciples." T.D. 22p., with a few ink corrections.
Chilanti, Felice. "Going South--Desperation and Bandits." T.D. 3p. (possibly incomplete). Extensively corrected in EP's and DP's hands. Undated.
Cicogna, Giorgio. Poem: "Hymn to Mathematics." T.Ds. 5p. each of the original Italian text and of the English translation by Helen Rossetti Angeli..
Dolmetsch, Arnold. "17th and 18th Century Music." Galleys of pages 416-470, clean. 13 sheets.
Dudek, Louis. Poems: "A Solitary Guest," "Les Innocents," "Wife," "Provençal Poets," and "The God Pan Hears Jazz." Ribbon/carbon mix of typescripts. 5p., four of the poems signed..
Poems: "Moving Picture," "Romantic Matter," and "Calypso." T.Ds.S. 3p. each
Duncan, Robert. Poem: "A Description of Venice." T.(carbon). 23p., clean.
Untitled poem beginning "Great Venus came into the room." T.D. 1p., clean.
T.L.S. from Duncan to EP. 1p. , but 1950s, describing his studies of oriental languages, etc.
Duncan, Robert, et al. "A Canto for E.P." T.(carbon) 7p. but probably mid 1940s. Few minor pencilled changes and markings.
Another copy, T.(carbon) 6p., with a few minor corrections, and pencilled notes by EP on verso of last page "copied. Washington.D.C.," .
English, Maurice. Translation into English of poems by Eugenio Montale and Umberto Saba. Three printed broadsheets (approx. 16x12). Folded.
Ewart, Gavin and Jack Clark. "Uncle Tom's Cabin (Fragment of a Parody)" T.D. 2p. Published Poetry London .
Fang, Achilles. "Imagism and The Chinese Renaissance." T.(carbon)D. 26p., with some corrections by author and with Chinese ideograms inked in..

Fang, Achilles. "Some reflexions [sic] on the difficulty of translation." T.(ditto copy)D. 54p., with some corrections by author.. [Fang was a Sinologist at Harvard who was important to EP's Chinese studies].
Gallup, Donald. "T.S. Elliot and Ezra Pound, Collaborators in Letters." T(photocopy)D. 35p., with some ink markings..
Giovannini, Giovanni. "The Case of Ezra Pound." T.(carbon)D. 11p., with several corrections. With cover T.L.S..
Hart, Bill. "Nonsuch Land of Water." First chapter of book by William Beebe. T.D. 9p., with several corrections. Copied by Hart and sent to EP with a cover T.L..
Howe, Henrietta. "The New Atlas." T.(carbon)D. 41p., with corrections..
Hughes, Raymond. Play: "The King's Pleasure." T.(carbon)D. 89p., with some underlining.. [Hughes, a Welsh writer, was connected with the periodical "Four Pages."]
Kenner, Hugh. "The Chisel," review of Basil Bunting's Poems: 1950. T.(carbon). 5p., with "Sent to Poetry - H.K." on top page, and envelope addressed to EP ().
Kimball, Dudley. "Discussion Report: I" Printed galley. 1p., inscribed by author
Koch, Paul (under pseudonym Pablo Owens). Poems. T.Ds. ca. 50p., with some minor marks in EP's hand.ca..
Mullins, Eustace. His Spirit Tower. Printed page proofs. ca. 50p. Published by Cleaner's Press in an edition of 99 copies.
Musgrave, Thea. "Five Songs." Holograph musical manuscript in ink, setting EP and Louis MacNiece poems to music. 18p. Probably unpublished.
Paige, D.D. "The Resurgence of Adib Jabbor." T.D. 11p., with a few corrections..
Pease, Maj. Frank. Play "'It's Gotta Get Worse!' A Slight Play for Joiners." T.(carbon)D. 17p., clean..
Pelo Pardi, Guilio del. "For World Peace." Translated from the Italian. T.(carbon) of Preface. 6p., clean..
For World Peace. T.D., 9p. Accompanied by envelope from Giovanni Giovannini addressed to Dorothy Pound and postmarked.
Pound, Ezra. Articles: "Poisoned Supply Pipes," T.(carbon)D. 4p., clean.
A Means of Communication, T.(carbon)D. 6p., clean. Translations from the Italian (translator unknown) from Orientamenti (Gallup A55).
Pound, Ezra. Essay: "Totalitarian Scholarship and the New Paideuma," edited by Douglas Fox (Gallup C1405). A.D. 9p., probably in hand of Douglas Fox. Published in Germany and You.
Quinn, Sister Bernetta. "Conclusion." Apparently the last chapter of her book Metamorphosis in Modern American Poetry. T.D. 15p., with a few corrections.
Rachewiltz, Boris de. Incantesimi e Scongiuri (Verona, Scheiwiller). Printed page proofs. 44p., with some corrections.

Somers, Homer L. Article: "Ezra Pound J'ayme; donc, Je suis." T.D. 5p. Probably a draft, with moderate corrections. [Somers was an American army officer who first met EP during his detention at Pisa in 1945.]
Stewart, Desmond. "The Memoirs of Alcibiades." T.(carbon)D. 138p., clean..
Stock, Noel. The Life of Ezra Pound . Carbon T.D. ca.600+ pages, with Noel Stock's corrections and queries to DP in blue; and with Dorothy Pound's corrections and replies to Stock in red.
Swabey, Henry. To the Editor, Calvacade. "The Confiscation Racket." T.(carbon)D.S. 2p., with "Draft for EP" in pencil.
Swabey, Henry. "Mental Blackout." T.D. 2p., plus 2 carbon copies.
Swabey, Henry (under pseudonym Enery der Swabe). "Middle Class Marathon." T.(carbon)D.S. 2p., with a few ink corrections..
Thomas, Jessie. "I Walked in My Garden" [music]. A.D.S., in pencil. 4p.. Inscribed to Mr. & Mrs. Pound, .
Villari, Luigi. "The Communist Defeat in Italy." T.(carbon)D. 2p., clean, with a short typed note appended by EP.
Whigham, Peter. "Conker Avenue and Other Poems." T.D. 36 p., with several corrections by author. Inscribed to DP
Whigham, Peter. "Ezra Pound." T.(mimeographed)D., 10p., with some corrections in ink..
Wilson, R. McNair. Play: "Dukes Must Do It." T.(carbon)D. 133p., with some autograph corrections in ink..

Yankowski, Stanislaus. "Ezra Pound's Translation of Sophocles." Published in EP's Women of Trachis(Gallup A72). T.(carbon)D. 9p., with a few corrections; accompanied by "Note on the CHOROI in the EP's Women of Trachis." T.D. 1p. Also, a probable later version, T.D., 8p. and a cover T.L.: SY to EP.
Unknown (but possibly by Villari or written for Il Tempo). "Colloquio con Il Camerata." T.(carbon)D. 4p., clean..
Unknown. Poem: "Dinner at the Acropolis (for Barbara). T.D. 1p. .
Unknown. Article: "E Nato l'Uomo Cinque." T.(copy)D. 7p. In Italian. .
Unknown. Untitled essay beginning "Elliot is beyond doubt...." T.(carbon)D. 2p., clean..
Unknown (but possibly by Eustace Mullins). Chapters 13-19 of a work on history of money, etc. T.D. 67p. (hand numbered pages 186-253). Chap. 13, titled: "Money in Europe in the 1930s.".
Unknown. "The Nature of Our Quarrel with the Soviet Union." T.(carbon)D. 3p.
Unknown. Poems: "October," "Oh Lord Establish Thou the Labor of My Hands," and "My Shadow. T.Ds. 4p., clean. with EP's note: "Whose?" on last page.
Unknown. Poems. T.(carbons)D. 4p. 3/20/49, 3/21/49 and 3/27/49. Three pages are heavily corrected/revised, in pencil, by EP.
Unknown. Poems: "Spiritual Pilgrimage (Divina Comedia)," with " S.O.S." appended. T.(carbons). 2p.
Unknown. Essay: "Temper of the Whelk." T.D. 4p. Also a cover illustration in ink. .

Yockey, Francis Parker. "Press release: What is behind the hanging of the eleven Jews in Prague?" Printed (mimeograph?). 9p. With a cover printed letter from Le Blanc Publishers. "For release Dec. 20th." [1953?]
